sense.name: spurt
sense.examples: Oil gushed out from the hole in the tanker. The blood gushed hot on the muddy straw. The waters gush from San Solomon Springs at 18 million gallons a day The wind gushed, almost a tornado. It was a gush of worthwhile information. Staubback Falls fush out from sheer cliffs onto a rugged precipice.

sense.name: rave about
sense.examples: "He's a genuine Wheaties box athlete," gushes Mr. Jones. Glossy brochures gush about the limelight of the winner's circle. Their coaches gush about the pleasure of working with them. "He's just too good to be true!" one woman gushed after meeting him. Jack Staub can't gush enough about a particular herb now at its peak She'll gush about her love of Dolly Parton. I can take the time and just gush about how wonderful I feel.
